snippet: Gov. Gray Davis today banned use of the additive M.T.B.E. in gasoline sold in California, saying the compound posed ''a significant risk'' to the environment.    The Governor's order requires the state to begin phasing out M.T.B.E. from California...
lead_paragraph: Gov. Gray Davis today banned use of the additive M.T.B.E. in gasoline sold in California, saying the compound posed ''a significant risk'' to the environment. The Governor's order requires the state to begin phasing out M.T.B.E. from California gasoline, with 100 percent removal by 2002.
abstract: Gov Gray Davis bans use of additive MTBE in gasoline sold in California, saying compound poses 'significant risk' to environment (S)

headline.main: National News Briefs; California Governor Bans Use of Gasoline Additive
